  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER AT DOOR IN PRELOAD USING THE DECISION TREE, THE PACKAGE WAS ON THE FLOOR, NO CLEAN UP, THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED THERE BY EMPLOYEE IN THE PRELOAD, RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE DMP CAGE TO PROCESS. RESPONDER DISCOVERED LEAKAGE CAME FROM CAP.

item.title: Report E-2023090559
item.description:
Report E-2023090559

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: CERES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN1903 were damaged by a load shift and released approximately a quarter (0.25) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon to remediate the site. Ancon personnel deployed granular absorbents to the disinfectant-impacted trailer interior and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and impacted wood were collected and containerized into one (1)30-gallon drum for terminal disposal. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was located in the unload package was wet and ripped after a full inspection I noticed that two caps was loose to cal-x causing it to leak DescribePack: loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: used absorbent material to soak up liquid

item.title: Report X-2023090320
item.description:
Report X-2023090320

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager noticed that hazmat pail was leaking all over the floor. Manager then placed absorbent sheets underneath the pail to help it to not spread. QA was notified about the leaking HazMat to come and collect it. Hazmat was placed into a white clear hazmat bag with absorbent sheets and then placed into a red hazmat tote. DescribePack: Bottom part of the plastic pail was punctured which led to the corrosive liquid to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a clear hazmat bag with absorbent to help stop the liquid from coming out. Absorbent sheets were used to clean up the spilled liquid on the floor, and the hazmat bag was then placed inside the hazmat tote to get taken to the hazmat cage to get processed.

DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED SLOWLY FROM CAP, BODY SUCKED IN SEVERELY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND DUSTPAN. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at the unload. The manager was called to see a damaged hazmat. DescribePack: The outer box was wet near the fold of the top of the box, on one of the sides. The inner packaging was wet and soiled with corrosive liquid. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a tote lined with a bag and then taken to the HMPA for further processing.

item.title: Report X-2023081955
item.description:
Report X-2023081955

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-26
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023081955 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD RLTO TRAILER 560882 WET ON TOP AND LEAKING. DAMAGED IN TRANSIT. PACKAGE PACKED INTO TRAILER UPSIDE DOWN. DescribePack: THREE BOTTLES WITH SUCKED IN BODIES. CAPS, THOUGH TIGHT, SLOWLY LEAKED. HALF GALLON LOSS OF MATERIAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL NEUTRALIZED AND COLLECTED WITH PHNINE AND SMALL BROOM. PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM. 2. X-2023081958 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD RLTO TRAILER 560882 WET. DAMAGED IN TRANSIT INITIALLY FROM ANOTHER DAMAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE BUT ALSO HAS INTERNAL LEAKAGE FROM LOOSE CAP. DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM CAP AN EIGHTH OF A TURN LOOSE. ONE TENTH OF A GALLON LOSS. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that the one poly 5 gallon pail of klean strip acetoin (un1090) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 5 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors wwre dispatched.

item.title: Report E-2023090624
item.description:
Report E-2023090624

item.title: Report I-2023090101
item.description:
Report I-2023090101

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: Santa Clara
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: INGENIUM GROUP, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Around 6:30am, the yard personnel were in the process of transferring containers to different trailers when they noticed a tote that might have a possible leak around the valve. They prepped an empty tote in the event there was a need to transfer the material out of the tote. Once they were all prepped, they checked the valve handle to make sure it was fully in the closed position. When the outlet cap was unscrewed, the material shot out of the valve due to a missing ball valve. Over half of the material was captured in the second tote and approximately 125 gals of the material released to the asphalt around the load dock. There was no release to the environment. The yard team quickly controlled the release with berms, absorbents, and vermiculite/floor dry and proceeded to clean up the material.

X-2023081865 SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet on the corner of the outer container while been unloaded. package was place in to a hazmat bag and tote and take for inspection. upon inspection we found one of the four bottles had a loose cap causing it to leak approx 10oz all clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: The package was leaking from the bottle top due to a loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote with all clean up material. 2. X-2023081897 SequenceEvent: The package was found to had fallen of the roller on the unload area causing to leak. Package was place in a hazmat bag and tote and take for inspection. Upon inspection we found one of the four bottle had a loose cap causing to leak approx 10 oz of product. All clean up material was kept with package. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a loose cap causing to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was place in a hazmat bag and tote.
